subject: Football
College Athletics
Coaches and Managers
lead_paragraph: The Southern California offensive coordinator Steve Sarkisian, 34, became the third-youngest coach in major college football, when he was introduced as Tyrone Willingham’s successor at Washington. Sarkisian, who will coach U.S.C. through its Rose Bowl game on Jan. 1, will receive a five-year deal worth $10 million and incentives.
